verses.kjv: And the king sent, and they gathered unto him all the elders of Judah and of Jerusalem.
verses.web: The king sent, and they gathered to him all the elders of Judah and of Jerusalem.
verses.ct: The king sent messengers and gathered all the elders of Judah and Jerusalem to himself.

verses.kjv: And the king went up into the house of the LORD, and all the men of Judah and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem with him, and the priests, and the prophets, and all the people, both small and great: and he read in their ears all the words of the book of the covenant which was found in the house of the LORD.
verses.web: The king went up to LORD’s house, and all the men of Judah and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem with him, with the priests, the prophets, and all the people, both small and great; and he read in their hearing all the words of the book of the covenant which was found in LORD’s house.
verses.ct: Then the king went up to the house of the LORD, along with all the men of Judah, all the residents of Jerusalem, the priests, the prophets, and all the people — from the least to the greatest. He read aloud to them every word of the book of the covenant that had been found in the house of the LORD.

verses.kjv: And the king stood by a pillar, and made a covenant before the LORD, to walk after the LORD, and to keep his commandments and his testimonies and his statutes with all their heart and all their soul, to perform the words of this covenant that were written in this book. And all the people stood to the covenant.
verses.web: The king stood by the pillar, and made a covenant before LORD, to walk after LORD, and to keep his commandments, his testimonies, and his statutes, with all his heart, and all his soul, to confirm the words of this covenant that were written in this book; and all the people agreed to the covenant.
verses.ct: The king stood beside the pillar and made a covenant before the LORD — to follow the LORD and to obey his commands, his decrees, and his statutes with all his heart and all his soul, and to carry out the words of the covenant written in this book. All the people pledged themselves to the covenant.

verses.kjv: And the king commanded Hilkiah the high priest, and the priests of the second order, and the keepers of the door, to bring forth out of the temple of the LORD all the vessels that were made for Baal, and for the grove, and for all the host of heaven: and he burned them without Jerusalem in the fields of Kidron, and carried the ashes of them unto Bethel.
verses.web: The king commanded Hilkiah the high priest, and the priests of the second order, and the keepers of the threshold, to bring out of LORD’s temple all the vessels that were made for Baal, for the Asherah, and for all the army of the sky, and he burned them outside of Jerusalem in the fields of the Kidron, and carried their ashes to Bethel.
verses.ct: The king ordered Hilkiah the high priest, the priests next in rank, and the doorkeepers to remove from the temple of the LORD all the articles made for Baal, for the Asherah, and for all the host of heaven. He burned them outside Jerusalem in the fields of the Kidron Valley and carried their ashes to Bethel.

verses.kjv: And he put down the idolatrous priests, whom the kings of Judah had ordained to burn incense in the high places in the cities of Judah, and in the places round about Jerusalem; them also that burned incense unto Baal, to the sun, and to the moon, and to the planets, and to all the host of heaven.
verses.web: He got rid of the idolatrous priests, whom the kings of Judah had ordained to burn incense in the high places in the cities of Judah, and in the places around Jerusalem; those also who burned incense to Baal, to the sun, and to the moon, and to the planets, and to all the army of the sky.
verses.ct: He removed the idolatrous priests whom the kings of Judah had appointed to burn incense at the high places in the towns of Judah and in the areas around Jerusalem — those who burned incense to Baal, to the sun, the moon, the constellations, and all the host of heaven.

verses.kjv: And he brought out the grove from the house of the LORD, without Jerusalem, unto the brook Kidron, and burned it at the brook Kidron, and stamped it small to powder, and cast the powder thereof upon the graves of the children of the people.
verses.web: He brought out the Asherah from LORD’s house, outside of Jerusalem, to the brook Kidron, and burned it at the brook Kidron, and beat it to dust, and cast its dust on the graves of the common people.
verses.ct: He took the Asherah pole from the house of the LORD to the Kidron Valley outside Jerusalem, burned it there, ground it to powder, and scattered the dust over the graves of the common people.

verses.kjv: And he brake down the houses of the sodomites, that were by the house of the LORD, where the women wove hangings for the grove.
verses.web: He broke down the houses of the male shrine prostitutes that were in LORD’s house, where the women wove hangings for the Asherah.
verses.ct: He also tore down the quarters of the male shrine prostitutes that were in the house of the LORD, where women wove coverings for the Asherah.

verses.kjv: And he brought all the priests out of the cities of Judah, and defiled the high places where the priests had burned incense, from Geba to Beersheba, and brake down the high places of the gates that were in the entering in of the gate of Joshua the governor of the city, which were on a man’s left hand at the gate of the city.
verses.web: He brought all the priests out of the cities of Judah, and defiled the high places where the priests had burned incense, from Geba to Beersheba; and he broke down the high places of the gates that were at the entrance of the gate of Joshua the governor of the city, which were on a man’s left hand at the gate of the city.
verses.ct: He brought all the priests from the towns of Judah and desecrated the high places where the priests had burned incense, from Geba to Beersheba. He also demolished the high places at the gates — the one at the entrance to the gate of Joshua the city governor, which was on the left side as one enters the city gate.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless the priests of the high places came not up to the altar of the LORD in Jerusalem, but they did eat of the unleavened bread among their brethren.
verses.web: Nevertheless the priests of the high places didn’t come up to LORD’s altar in Jerusalem, but they ate unleavened bread among their brothers.
verses.ct: However, the priests of the high places were not allowed to serve at the altar of the LORD in Jerusalem, though they could eat unleavened bread among their fellow priests.

verses.kjv: And he defiled Topheth, which is in the valley of the children of Hinnom, that no man might make his son or his daughter to pass through the fire to Molech.
verses.web: He defiled Topheth, which is in the valley of the children of Hinnom, that no man might make his son or his daughter to pass through the fire to Molech.
verses.ct: He also desecrated Topheth in the Valley of Ben Hinnom, so that no one could sacrifice his son or daughter in the fire to Molech.

verses.kjv: And he took away the horses that the kings of Judah had given to the sun, at the entering in of the house of the LORD, by the chamber of Nathanmelech the chamberlain, which was in the suburbs, and burned the chariots of the sun with fire.
verses.web: He took away the horses that the kings of Judah had given to the sun, at the entrance of LORD’s house, by the room of Nathan Melech the officer, who was in the court; and he burned the chariots of the sun with fire.
verses.ct: He removed the horses that the kings of Judah had dedicated to the sun at the entrance to the house of the LORD, near the room of Nathan Melech the official, which was in the court. Then he burned the chariots of the sun with fire.

verses.kjv: And the altars that were on the top of the upper chamber of Ahaz, which the kings of Judah had made, and the altars which Manasseh had made in the two courts of the house of the LORD, did the king beat down, and brake them down from thence, and cast the dust of them into the brook Kidron.
verses.web: The king broke down the altars that were on the roof of the upper room of Ahaz, which the kings of Judah had made, and the altars which Manasseh had made in the two courts of LORD’s house, and beat them down from there, and cast their dust into the brook Kidron.
verses.ct: The king demolished the altars on the roof of the upper room of Ahaz, which the kings of Judah had built, as well as the altars Manasseh had built in the two courtyards of the house of the LORD. He smashed them and threw their rubble into the Kidron Valley.

verses.kjv: And the high places that were before Jerusalem, which were on the right hand of the mount of corruption, which Solomon the king of Israel had builded for Ashtoreth the abomination of the Zidonians, and for Chemosh the abomination of the Moabites, and for Milcom the abomination of the children of Ammon, did the king defile.
verses.web: The king defiled the high places that were before Jerusalem, which were on the right hand of the mountain of corruption, which Solomon the king of Israel had built for Ashtoreth the abomination of the Sidonians, and for Chemosh the abomination of Moab, and for Milcom the abomination of the children of Ammon.
verses.ct: The king also desecrated the high places east of Jerusalem, on the south side of the Mount of Corruption — the ones Solomon king of Israel had built for Ashtoreth, the detestable goddess of the Sidonians, for Chemosh, the detestable god of Moab, and for Milcom, the detestable god of the Ammonites.

verses.kjv: And he brake in pieces the images, and cut down the groves, and filled their places with the bones of men.
verses.web: He broke in pieces the pillars, cut down the Asherah poles, and filled their places with men’s bones.
verses.ct: He smashed the sacred pillars, cut down the Asherah poles, and filled those sites with human bones.

verses.kjv: Moreover the altar that was at Bethel, and the high place which Jeroboam the son of Nebat, who made Israel to sin, had made, both that altar and the high place he brake down, and burned the high place, and stamped it small to powder, and burned the grove.
verses.web: Moreover the altar that was at Bethel, and the high place which Jeroboam the son of Nebat, who made Israel to sin, had made, even that altar and the high place he broke down; and he burned the high place and beat it to dust, and burned the Asherah.
verses.ct: He also demolished the altar at Bethel and the high place that Jeroboam son of Nebat had built — the one who led Israel into sin. He tore down that altar and the high place, burned the high place, crushed it to powder, and burned the Asherah pole.

verses.kjv: And as Josiah turned himself, he spied the sepulchres that were there in the mount, and sent, and took the bones out of the sepulchres, and burned them upon the altar, and polluted it, according to the word of the LORD which the man of God proclaimed, who proclaimed these words.
verses.web: As Josiah turned himself, he spied the tombs that were there in the mountain; and he sent, and took the bones out of the tombs, and burned them on the altar, and defiled it, according to LORD’s word which the man of God proclaimed, who proclaimed these things.
verses.ct: When Josiah looked around, he noticed the tombs on the hillside. He sent men to take the bones from the tombs and burned them on the altar, defiling it. This fulfilled the word of the LORD spoken by the man of God who had predicted these very things.

verses.kjv: Then he said, What title is that that I see? And the men of the city told him, It is the sepulchre of the man of God, which came from Judah, and proclaimed these things that thou hast done against the altar of Bethel.
verses.web: Then he said, “What monument is that which I see?” The men of the city told him, “It is the tomb of the man of God, who came from Judah, and proclaimed these things that you have done against the altar of Bethel.”
verses.ct: Then he asked, "What is that marker I see?" The men of the city told him, "It is the tomb of the man of God who came from Judah and proclaimed the very things you have done to the altar of Bethel."

verses.kjv: And he said, Let him alone; let no man move his bones. So they let his bones alone, with the bones of the prophet that came out of Samaria.
verses.web: He said, “Let him be! Let no one move his bones.” So they let his bones alone, with the bones of the prophet who came out of Samaria.
verses.ct: He said, "Leave it alone. No one is to disturb his bones." So they left his bones undisturbed, along with the bones of the prophet who had come from Samaria.

verses.kjv: And all the houses also of the high places that were in the cities of Samaria, which the kings of Israel had made to provoke the Lord to anger, Josiah took away, and did to them according to all the acts that he had done in Bethel.
verses.web: All the houses also of the high places that were in the cities of Samaria, which the kings of Israel had made to provoke LORD to anger, Josiah took away, and did to them according to all the acts that he had done in Bethel.
verses.ct: Josiah also removed all the shrines at the high places in the towns of Samaria that the kings of Israel had built, provoking the Lord to anger. He did to them exactly what he had done at Bethel.

verses.kjv: And he slew all the priests of the high places that were there upon the altars, and burned men’s bones upon them, and returned to Jerusalem.
verses.web: He killed all the priests of the high places that were there, on the altars, and burned men’s bones on them; and he returned to Jerusalem.
verses.ct: He slaughtered all the priests of the high places on their own altars and burned human bones on them. Then he returned to Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And the king commanded all the people, saying, Keep the passover unto the LORD your God, as it is written in the book of this covenant.
verses.web: The king commanded all the people, saying, “Keep the Passover to LORD your God, as it is written in this book of the covenant.”
verses.ct: The king gave this command to all the people: "Celebrate the Passover to the LORD your God, as it is written in this book of the covenant."

verses.kjv: Surely there was not holden such a passover from the days of the judges that judged Israel, nor in all the days of the kings of Israel, nor of the kings of Judah;
verses.web: Surely there was not kept such a Passover from the days of the judges who judged Israel, nor in all the days of the kings of Israel, nor of the kings of Judah;
verses.ct: No Passover like this one had been observed since the days of the judges who led Israel, nor throughout the entire era of the kings of Israel or the kings of Judah.

verses.kjv: But in the eighteenth year of king Josiah, wherein this passover was holden to the LORD in Jerusalem.
verses.web: but in the eighteenth year of king Josiah, this Passover was kept to LORD in Jerusalem.
verses.ct: But in the 18th year of King Josiah, this Passover was celebrated to the LORD in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: Moreover the workers with familiar spirits, and the wizards, and the images, and the idols, and all the abominations that were spied in the land of Judah and in Jerusalem, did Josiah put away, that he might perform the words of the law which were written in the book that Hilkiah the priest found in the house of the LORD.
verses.web: Moreover Josiah removed those who had familiar spirits, the wizards, and the teraphim, and the idols, and all the abominations that were seen in the land of Judah and in Jerusalem, that he might confirm the words of the law which were written in the book that Hilkiah the priest found in LORD’s house.
verses.ct: Josiah also got rid of the mediums, the spiritists, the household idols, the images, and every other detestable thing found in the land of Judah and in Jerusalem. He did this to fulfill the words of the law written in the book that Hilkiah the priest had found in the house of the LORD.

verses.kjv: And like unto him was there no king before him, that turned to the LORD with all his heart, and with all his soul, and with all his might, according to all the law of Moses; neither after him arose there any like him.
verses.web: There was no king like him before him, who turned to LORD with all his heart, and with all his soul, and with all his might, according to all the law of Moses; and there was none like him who arose after him.
verses.ct: There was no king like him before or after — one who turned to the LORD with all his heart, with all his soul, and with all his strength, in full obedience to the law of Moses.

verses.kjv: Notwithstanding the LORD turned not from the fierceness of his great wrath, wherewith his anger was kindled against Judah, because of all the provocations that Manasseh had provoked him withal.
verses.web: Notwithstanding, LORD didn’t turn from the fierceness of his great wrath, with which his anger burned against Judah, because of all the provocation with which Manasseh had provoked him.
verses.ct: Even so, the LORD did not turn away from the fury of his great wrath that burned against Judah because of all the ways Manasseh had provoked him.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said, I will remove Judah also out of my sight, as I have removed Israel, and will cast off this city Jerusalem which I have chosen, and the house of which I said, My name shall be there.
verses.web: LORD said, “I will also remove Judah out of my sight, as I have removed Israel, and I will cast off this city which I have chosen, even Jerusalem, and the house of which I said, ‘My name shall be there.’ ”
verses.ct: The LORD declared, "I will remove Judah from my presence, just as I removed Israel. I will reject this city Jerusalem that I chose, and the house where I said, 'My name will be there.'"

verses.kjv: Now the rest of the acts of Josiah, and all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
verses.web: Now the rest of the acts of Josiah, and all that he did, aren’t they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
verses.ct: As for the rest of the events of Josiah's reign and everything he accomplished, are they not recorded in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?

verses.kjv: In his days Pharaohnechoh king of Egypt went up against the king of Assyria to the river Euphrates: and king Josiah went against him; and he slew him at Megiddo, when he had seen him.
verses.web: In his days Pharaoh Necoh king of Egypt went up against the king of Assyria to the river Euphrates; and king Josiah went against him; and Pharaoh Necoh killed him at Megiddo, when he had seen him.
verses.ct: During Josiah's reign, Pharaoh Necho king of Egypt marched to the Euphrates River to assist the king of Assyria. King Josiah went out to confront him, but Pharaoh Necho killed him at Megiddo when they met in battle.

verses.kjv: And his servants carried him in a chariot dead from Megiddo, and brought him to Jerusalem, and buried him in his own sepulchre. And the people of the land took Jehoahaz the son of Josiah, and anointed him, and made him king in his father’s stead.
verses.web: His servants carried him in a chariot dead from Megiddo, and brought him to Jerusalem, and buried him in his own tomb. The people of the land took Jehoahaz the son of Josiah, and anointed him, and made him king in his father’s place.
verses.ct: His servants carried his body in a chariot from Megiddo, brought him to Jerusalem, and buried him in his own tomb. Then the people of the land took Jehoahaz son of Josiah, anointed him, and made him king in his father's place.

verses.kjv: Jehoahaz was twenty and three years old when he began to reign; and he reigned three months in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name was Hamutal, the daughter of Jeremiah of Libnah.
verses.web: Jehoahaz was twenty-three years old when he began to reign; and he reigned three months in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was Hamutal the daughter of Jeremiah of Libnah.
verses.ct: Jehoahaz was 23 years old when he became king, and he reigned 3 months in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Hamutal daughter of Jeremiah of Libnah.

verses.kjv: And he did that which was evil in the sight of the LORD, according to all that his fathers had done.
verses.web: He did that which was evil in LORD’s sight, according to all that his fathers had done.
verses.ct: He did what was evil in the sight of the LORD, just as his ancestors had done.

verses.kjv: And Pharaohnechoh put him in bands at Riblah in the land of Hamath, that he might not reign in Jerusalem; and put the land to a tribute of an hundred talents of silver, and a talent of gold.
verses.web: Pharaoh Necoh put him in bonds at Riblah in the land of Hamath, that he might not reign in Jerusalem; and put the land to a tribute of one hundred talents of silver, and a talent of gold.
verses.ct: Pharaoh Necho imprisoned him at Riblah in the land of Hamath to prevent him from reigning in Jerusalem, and he imposed on the land a tribute of 100 talents of silver and a talent of gold.

verses.kjv: And Pharaohnechoh made Eliakim the son of Josiah king in the room of Josiah his father, and turned his name to Jehoiakim, and took Jehoahaz away: and he came to Egypt, and died there.
verses.web: Pharaoh Necoh made Eliakim the son of Josiah king in the place of Josiah his father, and changed his name to Jehoiakim; but he took Jehoahaz away, and he came to Egypt and died there.
verses.ct: Pharaoh Necho made Eliakim son of Josiah king in place of his father Josiah and changed his name to Jehoiakim. He took Jehoahaz away to Egypt, where he died.

verses.kjv: And Jehoiakim gave the silver and the gold to Pharaoh; but he taxed the land to give the money according to the commandment of Pharaoh: he exacted the silver and the gold of the people of the land, of every one according to his taxation, to give it unto Pharaohnechoh.
verses.web: Jehoiakim gave the silver and the gold to Pharaoh; but he taxed the land to give the money according to the commandment of Pharaoh. He exacted the silver and the gold of the people of the land, from everyone according to his assessment, to give it to Pharaoh Necoh.
verses.ct: Jehoiakim paid the silver and gold to Pharaoh, but he taxed the land to raise the money Pharaoh demanded. He collected the silver and gold from the people of the land, each person according to his assessment, and gave it to Pharaoh Necho.

verses.kjv: Jehoiakim was twenty and five years old when he began to reign; and he reigned eleven years in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name was Zebudah, the daughter of Pedaiah of Rumah.
verses.web: Jehoiakim was twenty-five years old when he began to reign, and he reigned eleven years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was Zebidah the daughter of Pedaiah of Rumah.
verses.ct: Jehoiakim was 25 years old when he became king, and he reigned 11 years in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Zebudah daughter of Pedaiah of Rumah.

verses.kjv: And he did that which was evil in the sight of the LORD, according to all that his fathers had done.
verses.web: He did that which was evil in LORD’s sight, according to all that his fathers had done.
verses.ct: He did what was evil in the sight of the LORD, just as his ancestors had done.
